channel.title: iFrame Paradox
channel.description:
1.html: [code] <body style="background-color: yellow;"> <iframe src="2.html" width="95%" height="95%"></iframe> </body> [/code]
2.html: [code] <body style="background-color: blue;"> <iframe src="1.html" width="95%" height="95%"></iframe> </body> [/code]
Can anyone explain to me why I only see two embedded iframes, and the innermost iframe is the wrong colour anyway?
I want an endless loop of iframes :mad: :mad:

item.title: iFrame Paradox
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:26, topic:336022”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=432402.msg3187087#msg3187087 date=1271873120]
Chrome doesn’t even sweat
[/quote]
how could a browser sweat?[/quote]That’s why it doesn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: iFrame Paradox
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:23, topic:336022”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=432402.msg3179237#msg3179237 date=1271165584]
snip

As I recall, I think it was Kane I linked to it and he said he lost 3 hours worth of paper writing It works on earlier (2006 and before I think) versions of IE6. Should have used firefox…
[/quote]

This also happened to me! I was using:[size=1pt](brb pms)[/size]firefox: 1.5.0.9. Explain that![/quote]

Maybe you had a virus, or that ‘ietab’ extension installed. I’ve used firefox since something like 0.4, and it’s never taken the computer down.

Read full topic

item.title: iFrame Paradox
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:9, topic:336022”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=432402.msg3175695#msg3175695 date=1270832682]

Browsers aren’t made by 14 year olds, sorry =\

Some of them are, like when an older version of ie6 could make your computer have a BSOD when the width and height of an image was out of range.
[/quote]
A buffer overflow in IE could crash the computer? Windows is seriously fucked up if basic application sandboxing doesn’t work.[/quote][quote=“Thug-life, post:10, topic:336022”]Yeah, you still see those pages out there with people trying to catch people out with it.[/quote]

I’ve had this page up for as long as I can remember, I used to get people with it all the time:

http://www.moparisthebest.com/no.html

As I recall, I think it was Kane I linked to it and he said he lost 3 hours worth of paper writing It works on earlier (2006 and before I think) versions of IE6. Should have used firefox…

Read full topic

item.title: iFrame Paradox
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

ROFL Win 2K was not a good operating system? Its the only good one out of 95, 98. NT wasnt even that bad seeing thats what I upgraded it from and it was working fine before that. I still use the Win 2k machine to browse the internet and do word processing. Most of the linux distros barely had a UI when Win 2K was released it looked like someone took shit and smeared it all over the UI.

He said it was not good when it came out, which is totally correct.

Also, good job at derailing the thread, even though it was pointless anyway…

Read full topic

item.title: iFrame Paradox
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:13, topic:336022”]Perfectly fine is different from well. Windows 2k wasn’t good when it was released, Linux runs best. I’ve used windows my entire life, going from one BSOD to another… I switched to Ubuntu while my computer was at a crawl, formatted my HDD and got rid of everything windows related. Wine is a better windows IMO =][/quote]Are you retarded? Wine is NOT a better Windows as Wine is NOT an operating system. Oh and by the way gnome can suck my anus being so bulky and shit.

Read full topic

item.title: iFrame Paradox
item.dc:creator: @Koolvin Koolvin
item.description:
@Koolvin wrote:

I’ve used windows my entire life, going from one BSOD to another… I switched to Ubuntu while my computer was at a crawl, formatted my HDD and got rid of everything windows related. Wine is a better windows IMO =]
